In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the code snippet to solve this problem using Julia DataFrames package.
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((x) -> DateFormat("yyyymm")(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```
In this function, we use the `map` function to apply a function to each element in the column `:dt`. The function takes a DateTime and returns it formatted as "yyyymm". This new column is then added to the DataFrame under the name `:ym`. 

Please note that you need to have the DataFrames package installed in your Julia environment. If not, install it using `Pkg.add("DataFrames")`.
